intro: Tetramyxis bonii, commonly known as the Boni's tetramyxis, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and has hairy foliage. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
